page.title: 01The Village of Princetown
page.content:
Princetown village well-known for its prison, lies 7 miles E of Tavistock on the B3357 and 6 miles NE of Yelverton, at 1,400 feet above sea level.
Its situation in the southern area of the Dartmoor National Park appeals to people from all walks of life, who visit it either by car or coach or as part of a walking or camping holiday. From the village there are many interesting and varied walks, taking in Hut Circles and Standing Stones of Bronze Age origin, old tin mine workings, quarries and spectacular views for miles of unspoilt moorland. Within the village there are shops, cafes and all the usual amenities plus a camping site, a Residential Youth Centre (booking in advance) and a National Park Information Centre.
